page.title: 13LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: { The landscape consists of fields hedges and trees interspersed with a network of roads.The banks of the Cluden are of outstanding beauty. Pillars brought from Mabie House by Cowhill Estate in 1983 sit opposite old Holywood village. The "old" Newbridge 1794 and an apple store nearby are listed, as is the Church 1779,graveyard and manse 1773 1-4 School houses are listed as are cottages at Newington,East Cluden, the farmhouse, mill barn and house at West Cluden. Little remains of the mill except the caul which is now made of concrete. {Museum }A small private collection of deer trophies is kept in an old cottage at W. Cluden of particular interest to deer enthusiasts. It is owned by Mr McArthur.
